seriesJson.title: Unfinished business
seriesJson.description: A series of programs designed to acquaint listeners with unresolved social welfare problems.

node.title: They don't like school
node.description: This episode discusses what happens when children don't like school. What roles do educators and parents play in figuring out what to do when that happens?

node.title: No children allowed
node.description: This episode discusses the issue of families who live in substandard housing, along with corresponding health issues and the effects on children.

node.title: Understanding police
node.description: The sixth episode in this series looks at the ways that police departments and their respective communities can work together to improve services and relations.

node.title: People on the move - Program 5
node.description: This episode discusses the increasing frequency of household moves in America. The impact of itinerance upon people and their families is focused on.

node.title: Business breakdowns are costly
node.description: The fourth episode in this series looks at

node.title: Cold storage for juveniles
node.description: The tenth episode in this series discusses issues related to the experiences of teenage boys in the juvenile correction system.

node.title: You Mean I'm Mentally Ill? - Program 11
